page.title: 04INDUSTRY
page.content: B.T.R. is a rubber company in Dunstable built between 1938 and 1940. between thirty five and thirty eight years ago the products changed from making most rubber products to just car parts. Work was done by heavy labour. Nowadays B.T.R. is automated. Heating methods have changed from steam to electricity to oil. The breaks have changed today a rotating shift system operates. Workers came from local areas but now they come from places like Kettering and Milton Keynes. During the war people started younger than today and were payed less. There are longer holidays now but the retirement age is the same. During the war more women worked there but now the split is about even. B.T.R. has indeed changed a lot
